bibl.title: M. L. Coovert for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1890-1901, vol 1

div1.p: In re M. L. Coovert on Habeas Corpus.

Now on this day this cause come on regularly to be heard upon the ptition of M. L. Coovert for a writ of habeas corpus and the Court having duly considered the petition and the argument of C. E. S. Wood Esq., counsel for petitioner and of C. D. Bowles Esq., consel for George Nerton Sheriff, and being now sufficiently advised it is ordered that said petition be and the same is hereby granted. And the Clerk of the Court is directed to issue a writ of habeas corpus addressed to George Nerton Sheriff of the County of Clarke, State of Washington, returnable at Seattle June 22 1893, at ten o'clock A.M.
